questions.question: When you arrive at a scene, what is the first thing you should do?

choices.answer: take action- do what is required to save the casualty

questions.question: A girl who is a metre away from you is struggling to stay above  of the water. What do you do?

choices.answer: Jump in the water and help her
Lay down and reach her with your hand to pull her in
Use a rope to pull her in
Tell her to swim in herself

questions.question: There is a rip between the flags at a beach and someone is stuck in it . What do you do?

choices.answer: If the life savers haven't already noticed, inform them.
Swim over to them with a flotation device to give them
Grab a rope and throw it to them to pull them in
Tell a fellow swimmer to help them

questions.question: You are stuck in the ocean with a few others and help is a while away. What do you do?

choices.answer: Frantically wave your arms for help
Stay with the others and remain calm staying above the water
Swim freestyle towards your perceived direction of land
All swim in a different direction to find help

questions.question: A person is struggling to swim in a clear, deep pool. How do you enter to assist them?

choices.answer: Stride in entry, keeping your sight on the casualty
Dive in to get there quickly
Slide in, being careful of what's around you

questions.question: What does B stand for in DRSABCD?
Is it important to know life saving skills?

choices.answer: No, as life savers at a beach can help
Yes, as it is important in case your skills are required
Yes, as it is your responsibility to help when required
Yes, as it is compulsory to in QLD

questions.question: What is side stroke good for?

choices.answer: Conserving energy whilst moving towards your target

questions.question: You have to get to a casualty who is 25 m away. What stroke do you do?
When helping a casualty who is struggling to swim it is important to...

choices.answer: secure their hands when at safety
make sure they have food to eat after you save them

questions.question: Survival backstroke is the fastest stroke
It is important to keep your head above the water at all times

choices.answer: true- but if you get tired you can put it under

questions.question: Define life saving

choices.answer: Saving/attempting to save one from injury or illness
Helping a life saver save someone in danger

questions.question: Chlorine is dangerous in pools for babies skin
Drowning is a threat in young children when they are un supervised
In a stride in entry you...

choices.answer: Stride forward, keeping your head out of the water

questions.question: You must always keep the casualty calm
What kick do you do in survival backstroke?
You are entering clear, deep water from a jetty. what entry do you do?

choices.answer: Any entry is safe if you've checked the water is clear&deep

questions.question: What is survival freestyle?
